Look at the profit/loss diagrams in Figure 4. The diagram on the left is the profit from
holding the stock. If the stock's value is up, your profit is positive and if the stock's value
is down, your profit is negative. Profit equals the end price, Sr, less the initial price S,
That is, profit = Sr-s, The diagram on the right side of Figure 4 is the profit graph
from holding a long put. If the market is up, you lose your premium payment, and if the
market is down, you have a profit.
The value of the put at termination will be max[0, X- ST]. Your profit will be
max(0, X-ST] less the price of the put.
